Doc: A type defining the details for one of the transactions in an FX swap.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A type defining the details for one of the transactions in an FX swap.
 #/
record FpML5.confirmation.FxSwapLeg {
  # A reference to a party trade ID. This is provided in case the message creator wishes to record that the swap leg is assocatiated with a particular trade identifier; typically this is used for identifying a USI assocatied wih the leg.
  tradeIdentifierReference : FpML5.confirmation.PartyTradeIdentifierReference?

  # This is the first of the two currency flows that define a single leg of a standard foreign exchange transaction.
  exchangedCurrency1 : FpML5.confirmation.Payment

  # This is the second of the two currency flows that define a single leg of a standard foreign exchange transaction.
  exchangedCurrency2 : FpML5.confirmation.Payment

  # Indicates which currency was dealt.
  dealtCurrency : string?

  # A tenor expressed with a standard business term (i.e. Spot, TomorrowNext, etc.)
  tenorName : string

  # A tenor expressed as a period type and multiplier (e.g. 1D, 1Y, etc.)
  tenorPeriod : FpML5.confirmation.Period

  # The date on which both currencies traded will settle.
  valueDate : date

  # The date on which the currency1 amount will be settled. To be used in a split value date scenario.
  currency1ValueDate : date

  # The date on which the currency2 amount will be settled. To be used in a split value date scenario.
  currency2ValueDate : date

  # The rate of exchange between the two currencies.
  exchangeRate : FpML5.confirmation.ExchangeRate

  # Used to describe a particular type of FX forward transaction that is settled in a single currency (for example, a non-deliverable forward).
  nonDeliverableSettlement : FpML5.confirmation.FxCashSettlement?

  # Describes the disruption events and fallbacks applicable to a currency pair referenced by the transaction.
  disruption : FpML5.confirmation.FxDisruption?

  id : string?

}

tradeIdentifierReference.Doc: A reference to a party trade ID. This is provided in case the message creator wishes to record that the swap leg is assocatiated with a particular trade identifier; typically this is used for identifying a USI assocatied wih the leg.
tradeIdentifierReference.Name: tradeIdentifierReference

exchangedCurrency1.Doc: This is the first of the two currency flows that define a single leg of a standard foreign exchange transaction.
exchangedCurrency1.Name: exchangedCurrency1

exchangedCurrency2.Doc: This is the second of the two currency flows that define a single leg of a standard foreign exchange transaction.
exchangedCurrency2.Name: exchangedCurrency2

tenorName.Doc: A tenor expressed with a standard business term (i.e. Spot, TomorrowNext, etc.)
tenorName.Name: tenorName

tenorPeriod.Doc: A tenor expressed as a period type and multiplier (e.g. 1D, 1Y, etc.)
tenorPeriod.Name: tenorPeriod

valueDate.Doc: The date on which both currencies traded will settle.
valueDate.Name: valueDate

currency1ValueDate.Doc: The date on which the currency1 amount will be settled. To be used in a split value date scenario.
currency1ValueDate.Name: currency1ValueDate

currency2ValueDate.Doc: The date on which the currency2 amount will be settled. To be used in a split value date scenario.
currency2ValueDate.Name: currency2ValueDate

exchangeRate.Doc: The rate of exchange between the two currencies.
exchangeRate.Name: exchangeRate

nonDeliverableSettlement.Doc: Used to describe a particular type of FX forward transaction that is settled in a single currency (for example, a non-deliverable forward).
nonDeliverableSettlement.Name: nonDeliverableSettlement

disruption.Doc: Describes the disruption events and fallbacks applicable to a currency pair referenced by the transaction.
disruption.Name: disruption
